page.title: 04ECOLOGY BEULAH - GARTH
page.content: Bird life is rich.Man-made Garth Lake, property of Garth House has large numbers of wild duck of various kinds in winter.Buzzards are common,red kite seen occasionally.Dipper and yellow wagtail on decline as insect larvae become scarce in rivers due to acid rain. Cammarch and Dulas now have no fish for same reason,the long term effect on trees is,as yet,unknown. Area of fairly high rainfall 40-50ins. per year. Frogs and toads still abundant,also bats.Foxes,polecats and grey squirrels common enough to be pests to farmers. Drainage of wet land causes loss of bog flowers. Wild flowers have been lost due to reseeding of pastures and mechanical trimming of verges and hedgebanks and hedges.
